text: [Music]
insomniacs unique because when we come
to a festival we show up to an empty
environment there's a lot of data
created and it's part of my job to
support all the different needs that
require some sort of interconnection or
network connectivity my name is David
Chen I'm the director of technology for
insomniac we capture about five to ten
terabytes of photos 30 terabytes of
video and for the live stream will
capture probably 30 to 40 terabytes of
video as well before our process would
be to pack and ship hard drives from the
festival back to the office and then
downloading it from the local drives
into our SAS array at home now I'm able
to rent a snowball each basically for a
festival weekend and then ship it back
whereas if I invested it in a storage I
would be using it for three days out of
a month and for the rest of the 27 days
it would sit in a warehouse just kind of
collecting dust
snowball edge gives us an opportunity to
share files between each other and
real-time is having having to run hard
drives upstairs or across the festival
AWS and Scovel edge really helped in
consolidating and streamlining our
operations the fact that has compute
power gives me some ideas about a way to
kind of like automate the tagging and
the categorization of all the photos
clustering is something I'm looking to
in the future as our data needs
increases because basically I can get a
bunch of snobol edges together and run
it as a single unit I think it's
essential for all our festivals just to
get all our data into a single secure
source there's a lot of you know
proprietary footage on there that
belongs to us and we enable a lot of the
security features for access for AWS
that helps us know that all our files
are protected and we should see there we
go and it's on our network
it's kind of fun to see everything
working everything jiving I mean we show
up and we spend 30 days building as a
town of 130,000 people and we tear down
and a week you know we do it every year
and we do it again and again and it's
